text.p: Italian debt futures closed easier but off session lows after a nervous session with all eyes on the U.S. markets and weaker T-bonds in the afternoon.
A raft of strong U.S. data out at 1500 GMT just as the Btp market was closing was first seen as negative and then seen differently which gave a push to prices, traders said.

"People had been waiting for these figures all day," one trader said. U.S. Treasuries immediately fell on the NAPM index for March of 55.0 against 53.1 in February, but then analysts examined the lower price index component.

February construction spending was up 2.3 percent, the biggest jump in a year, and leading indicators in February rose 0.5 percent. "But a second reading of the data, especially the NAPM, helped the market avoid touching new lows," one said.
The lira was steady against the mark with the dollar mixed but off lows after the data in a market keeping a wary eye on the stock market.
One analyst said the Btp contract's close below 124.00 could open up a new falling trend but noted that Bunds had recovered in late trade towards 99.50 after an intraday 99.26 low.
"With such nervous U.S. markets no one wants to go home with open positions," another said. "And the domestic situation over addressing the crucial issue of welfare reform isn't helping," he added.
